alert.note: Alert for Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 18 at 8:57AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding ongoing caused by excessive rainfall on Sunday. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Illinois, including the following county, Cook. Portions of northwest Indiana, including the following county, Lake IN. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 855 AM CDT, Emergency management reported ongoing ponding on roadways from heavy rain that fell on Sunday. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chicago, Hammond, Gary, Calumet City, East Chicago, Oak Forest, Harvey, Blue Island, Dolton, Homewood, South Holland, Country Club Hills, South Deering, Midlothian, Hazel Crest, Riverdale, Markham, Posen, Whiting and Dixmoor. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
